name: webpack error fix
content:
Error from webpack build:

ERROR in ./src/components/Dashboard/index.tsx 42:19

Module parse failed: Unexpected token (42:19)

You may need an appropriate loader to handle this file type,

currently no loaders are configured to process this file.

| import { useState } from 'react';

|

> const Dashboard = () => {

| const [data, setData] = useState(null);

| return (

from SO: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/67163729

Try adding this to webpack.config.js:

module: {

rules: [

{

test: /\.tsx?$/,

use: 'ts-loader',

exclude: /node_modules/

}

]

}

Also make sure typescript and ts-loader are installed:

npm install --save-dev typescript ts-loader

And add to tsconfig.json:

{

"compilerOptions": {

"outDir": "./dist/",

"sourceMap": true,

"noImplicitAny": true,

"module": "es6",

"target": "es5",

"jsx": "react",

"allowJs": true,

"moduleResolution": "node"

}

}

THIS FIXED IT!

other errors i got:

- Module not found: Error: Can't resolve 'react-dom'

- Cannot find module 'webpack' or its corresponding type declarations

- Type error: Property 'map' does not exist on type 'never'
